title: 28-year-old veteran charged with murder in connection with Armory Square homicide
content:
Error loading player: No playable sources found
SYRACUSE, N.Y. (WSYR-TV)
Syracuse Police have released the name of the man who was fatally shot early Thanksgiving morning in Armory Square.
According to police, staff at The Bar kicked out two men for getting into a minor physical altercation around 1:00 a.m., pushing them out into the streets.
The two continued the dispute on the street, when, according to police, 28-year-old Sangsouriyanh Maniphonh shot two rounds at 26-year-old Jonathan Diaz.
Diaz was struck in the chest. He was transported to the hospital where he later succumbed to his injuries.
Syracuse Police Chief Frank Fowler said the suspect is a legal gun owner, but that "alcohol and guns don't mix."
The two appeared to have had some history, but police are still looking into the incident.
There was a heavy police presence in the area, since the night before Thanksgiving is one of the city's most popular nights for locals to go out drinking, aside from St. Patrick's Day.
Officers arrested the suspect about two minutes after the shots rang out.
The suspect sustained an accidental self-inflicted gunshot wound to the hand.
Maniphonh, a military veteran, was charged with second-degree murder and could be facing 25 years to life if convicted.
Investigators are asking anyone with information to give them a call at 442-5222. All calls will be kept confidential.
